course.subject: ISDN
course.name: Physical Prototyping
course.description: The aim of this course is to take design concepts to reality. Students will convert their concepts that were created using sketches or 3D design software to tangible prototypes. Quick prototyping using various materials will provide hands-on experience. The course will also provide knowledge on various 3D prototyping technologies so that students can explore the most suitable means to generate functional and aesthetically pleasing prototypes. Hands-on experience with assembly to generate complete prototypes will be emphasized.

reviews.author: Yuan Qiao
reviews.comment_content: The content of the course is very useful.The aim of this course is to take design concepts to reality. Students will convert their concepts that were created using sketches or 3D design software to tangible prototypes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The course will also provide knowledge on various 3D prototyping technologies so that students can explore the most suitable means to generate functional and aesthetically pleasing prototypes
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading is very fair. The worst grade he gave is B.
reviews.comment_workload: To be honest. The workload is a bit heavy. But we can learn many techniques through the course.

reviews.author: PH
reviews.title: First hands-on project based course in the ISD Program
reviews.comment_content:
This project-based course in the ISD program is designed to equip students with all the necessary hands-on skills to do their prototyping in their future courses. Each weekly lecture is centred around technology or prototyping topics, and the lab session afterwards is supposed to offer students a hands-on experience with that technology. As this semester is held online, most lab sessions are scrapped and replaced with more presentations by the TA, Terrence. There will be a short canvas quiz afterwards for some of the advanced topics in the courses to test your knowledge.

The project topic for this semester is sterilization robots. Each team has to design and prototype a robot that can sterilize or clean an environment.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The content taught by professor Mitch Li is very interesting in it offers excellent insight into the prototyping process from a designer's standpoint. However, you will encounter that the students in the course have diverse backgrounds in prototyping and hands-on making stuff. Some students may already know all the course contents, like how to do 3d printing/ laser cutting/ coding and embedded system design, while others have never touched upon this technology.

In the first few weeks, each team need to propose a design as the goal for the course to prototype throughout the semester. But you don't need to worry about things getting out of hand as most teams will simplify their design throughout the semester, and there are a lot of PG TAs to help you.
reviews.comment_grading:
Labs/Assignments  40%
Quiz    15%     

Proposal     5%
Mid-Presentation  10%
Presentation    15%
Report   15%

The final grading is not that bad, as some teams will be unable to produce a working prototype by the end of the course. For our semester, during our final presentation, two groups were absent (applied for extension), and around five teams had a working prototype.
reviews.comment_workload: ISD students have no choice but to take this course but I will not suggest this course to minor students as the workload can be very high. For the last week, you will literally see the entire class staying in the lab for the full day and overnight to complete the project (except for one team who never appear in the lab for more than 5 minutes in the lab but still manage to bring in a fully functional prototype meeting their proposal during the final presentation.)

reviews.author: Carson Chan
reviews.title: Interesting course if you like making stuff
reviews.comment_content:
1. 3d scanning
2. range process pipeline and mesh segmentation
3. tolerance (in physical prototyping)
4. 3d printing
5. embedded system arduino
6. subtractive manufacturing
7. finishing (polish)
8. flexible prototyping
reviews.comment_teaching:
Sometimes it is quite boring as they are just speaking on the PowerPoint in Canvas, so basically you can read ahead and not listen to the instructors.

While some lecture is boring, the latter part of making the design is quite fun, though most of the time are do it yourselves as it is mainly online zoom, there are some support when it comes to the final project.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grade is alright.
Basically, as long as you have the prototype within the requirements, and it works as it should be, you will definitely get a B or above.

There are some bonus points for the final project
(our final project is an rc car that can go through the track, the fastest 5 teams gets extra points)
reviews.comment_workload:
the workload is decent, there were some tasks like making a 3d model from 3d float points and cleaning. Also making additional 3d features with the application of tolerances and fitting knowledge into the work.

the final project's workload will hugely depends on your teammate and your knowledge on mechanical knowledge and programming knowledge as you are using Arduino for the main controller.

There will also be some presentation required for reporting the progress of the design and the prototype. aka ppt stuff.

reviews.author: salter007
reviews.title: Fun and Good Grade course if you like building
reviews.comment_content:
3D Printing Hardware and Software
3D Scanning
More advanced modeling methods
–Geometry processing
–Solid modeling•
Metrology, Dimensioning, and Tolerancing
Simple Microcontroller and Internet of Things
Subtractive prototyping
Finishing
Flexible electronics prototyping
reviews.comment_teaching: Sai Kit and Mitch will be the one who teaches lectures and Terence Cheung is the TA who will teach the whole lab lesson. Both Professors are nice and eager to interact with students. Some of the isd classmates even followed them to do projects after this course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading:
Labs/Assignments40%
Quiz 15%
Project (Total 45%)
- Proposal  5%
- Mid-Presentation  10%
- Presentation15%
- Report 15%

The grading is fair. Basically you can get 80% of the lab work if the quality is fair. They are not difficult to finish so normally you can get high marks here. For the quiz, I am not sure how it is calculated but basically we had zoom quiz (just 5-8 questions) before some selected lab lessons.You can refer to the ppt of previous lessons to revise the quiz.

For the final project,

Two people in a group. We are making a mobility device (all made car at the end) this year and there are some requirement but they are easy to handle.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is fair also when it is an ISDN course. Weekly lab work and assignments are expected and very little paperwork. NO FINAL EXAMS !

What you need to do is to be a friend with the 3D printers, don't be deadline fighter or else you wont be able to submit the assignment on time, especially for the lab work of 3D printing.

If you are not new to electronics/ programming, this project would be a piece of cake for you and the workload is relatively light as well. Yet, if you are  a newbie, you may need to spend some time to get along with these first but it is still manageable!

reviews.author: HypernovaMatrix
reviews.comment_content:
3D scanning and mesh cleaning
Auxetic material
Linkages
Some basic engineering concept

Some lab is fun and exciting, for example making a beam with paper and see how many coins can it support. Can be really interesting if you make professor happy.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is fine, boring concepts can be boring, but is really useful for assignment, for example formulas to help you design auxetic materials. Listening and make notes would make your life easier when doing assignment. TA is helpful and is willing to help.
reviews.comment_grading:
Some iPRS for quiz marks
2 assignments for 3D scanning and auxetic material design
The final project is the most important:
Proposal, mid-presentation, final presentation, final report

Design something that moves with only one motor and implements all course material, i.e. linkages, 3D scanning and printing, auxetic material...
reviews.comment_workload: 2 relatively simple assignments, but the final project takes a lot of time to do well. don't start at the last moment and try to make it interesting so the professors like it.
